paragraphs.text: I marvel that there are so many wannabe dictators and control freaks out there. Why do you need an AR-15? Suppose I ask you why you need any of the things you buy, and presumed to sit in judgement over your purchases. You’d tell me to F-off, and rightly so. That’s all the reply anyone needs to make to you regarding why they need an AR-15, with or…

content.subtitle: Wish more arms dealers were like that.

ddc630eaaab5.title: There was a recent story at Ohio University (my old school) where a guy actually refused to sell…

paragraphs.text: There was a recent story at Ohio University (my old school) where a guy actually refused to sell guns to a student because the kid gave him ‘bad vibes’. Turned out the kid was planning an attack. I was really awestruck and grateful for that man’s ability to read people and to prioritize his feelings over his profit.

2d73a60ff480.title: I really like the personal touch in this piece.

paragraphs.text: I really like the personal touch in this piece. The frustration and anger reads sincere. So many things to highlight and comment on, but I definitely think one book that adds a good perspective on this issue is called “Glock” by Paul Barrett. I’d say this is one of the more complicated issues to fix legislatively and socially, but your column offers…

paragraphs.text: A “round” is one bullet. Every gun shoots off an “entire round” when you pull the trigger. I’m guessing you meant “magazine”, or maybe “clip”.
paragraphs.name: ad51

d030fbc922ea.title: I would amend that to we had a hand in it.

paragraphs.text: I would amend that to we had a hand in it. We as a country get exactly what we ask for and tolerate. And though I vote for gun control laws, I too have responsibility and culpability because I too am an American.
paragraphs.name: 4d07

bf7cbe210247.title: The AR-15 part is still factually incorrect.

paragraphs.text: The AR-15 part is still factually incorrect. 800 rounds a minute is the rate of fire of the M16 on it’s full auto setting. The AR-15 has this mechanism removed. It’s shoots about a fast as just pull the trigger. Accounting of course for overheating.
paragraphs.name: f4cc

b67482e5e797.title: Exactly! The second amendment is completely obsolete and it makes me crazy that people don’t…

paragraphs.text: Exactly! The second amendment is completely obsolete and it makes me crazy that people don’t realize it was a completely different environment, population and culture that enacted it. If the founders saw the way the 2nd amendment is abused today, they would be shaking their heads at our collective stupidity.

64c637e4ae17.title: Please educate yourself before you rant.

paragraphs.text: Please educate yourself before you rant. The ATFE that regulates the commerce of firearms does in fact have a lot of regulations regarding guns and their sale. They are a federal agency by the way.
How about we get rid of inaccurate writing on the internet? No one needs it and it could harm someone.

paragraphs.text: BUT WHY. THE FUCK. DO YOU HAVE ONE. LOCKED AND LOADED. NEXT TO YOUR BED. Who the FUCK did you piss off that you feel like you need a motherfucking MILITARY RIFLE that shoots off an ENTIRE ROUND when you pull the trigger?
paragraphs.name: c607

paragraphs.text: Our founding fathers weren’t carrying around AR-15s, you fucking assholes.
paragraphs.name: 2b5b

paragraphs.text: America has to have some accountability. Those who make the rules about selling guns in this country have to understand that every single time a movie theater or a church or a nightclub or FUCKING ELEMENTARY SCHOOL gets shot-up that THEY had a hand in it.
paragraphs.name: a4e4

paragraphs.text: And if, at some point, they were in danger, they wanted to have some kind of way to protect their family. BUT THEY WERE NOT VIGILANTES. Most of these people, if asked, would have said that they would not shoot to kill — it was just to buy them some time so that they could escape, or the police could arrive — THESE PEOPLE DID NOT DREAM OF BECOMING MURDERERS.
paragraphs.name: 5dc5

paragraphs.text: JUST LET THAT SINK IN: A behemoth company like Wal-Mart, which has been notoriously terrible about most everything, will not sell you a gun without a CLEARED background check.
The answer is extremely easy: Wal-Mart, which will sell you very reasonably priced guns, has tougher background check policies than the federal government requires.
paragraphs.name: c3ee

paragraphs.text: BUT WHY. THE FUCK. DO YOU HAVE ONE. LOCKED AND LOADED. NEXT TO YOUR BED. Who the FUCK did you piss off that you feel like you need a motherfucking MILITARY RIFLE that shoots off an ENTIRE ROUND when you pull the trigger?
paragraphs.name: c607
a00e
paragraphs.text: But what you have to understand is that there are also people who DO have these dreams. And because of how incredibly easy it is to obtain a gun in this country, they are able to achieve this dream in living color, while we all watch helplessly. We say they were terrorists or mentally ill. Sometimes they are. And that begs the question: then why the hell did the American people, who have a palpable distrust of both of these groups, sell them a god damn firearm?
